summary: Gio's Law amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to establish a grant program providing law enforcement with access to and training on the administration of epinephrine for anaphylactic reactions. The bill authorizes funding for purchasing epinephrine products and training officers to recognize symptoms and administer the medication. It also mandates an annual report on epinephrine administration by law enforcement and requires a public awareness campaign on anaphylaxis and the role of first responders.
